pullRequest.title: Silvio/dpc 710 attr performance test for orgs
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes DPC-710

This PR has turned into a major refactor for the Go performance/load tests:
Change Details


Added /Organization tests
Added /Practitioners tests
Created new package levels for dpc and targeter to diversify the file structure to make it more digestible.
The targeter package is now a self-contained generic targeter builder.
api.go contains all functionality having to do with the api outside of a testing context (i.e. creating tokens, refreshing access, etc...)
dpc.go contains all common helper functions/
All test files are prefixed with test_*.go to identify them.
Now that main.go has been cleaned up it can be simply run as go run main.go

Security Implications


 new software dependencies



 security controls or supporting software altered



 new data stored or transmitted



 security checklist is completed for this change



 requires more information or team discussion to evaluate security implications



 no PHI/PII is affected by this change


Acceptance Validation


Feedback Requested

commit.message: add org tests to test runner and insert recover cleanup catchall
Initial org test scaffolding plus POST/DELETE test runs

nodes.bodyText: Method orgTargeter.genReqs has a Cognitive Complexity of 17 (exceeds 9 allowed). Consider refactoring.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,150 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"encoding/json"
+	"fmt"
+	"io/ioutil"
+	"path/filepath"
+
+	vegeta "github.com/tsenart/vegeta/lib"
+)
+
+type orgTargetConfig struct {
+	Method      string
+	BaseURL     string
+	Path        string
+	AccessToken string
+	FilePattern string   // Optional file pattern location(s)
+	IDs         []string // Optional list of ids to append url
+}
+
+type orgTargeter struct {
+	reqs chan Req
+	orgTargetConfig
+}
+
+type Req struct {
+	id   *string
+	body []byte
+}
+
+func NewOrgTargeter(config orgTargetConfig) *orgTargeter {
+	targeter := &orgTargeter{
+		reqs:            make(chan Req),
+		orgTargetConfig: config,
+	}
+
+	targeter.genReqs()
+
+	return targeter
+}
+
+func (o *orgTargeter) genReqs() {

commit.message: Add base org test file and test json update request files
Remove access token pass to testOrganizationEndpoints test runner
Remove id generation from go routine, pair org create down to one and include PUT and GET request tests
Readd cleanup call at end of test run

nodes.bodyText: Method orgTargeter.genReqs has a Cognitive Complexity of 13 (exceeds 9 allowed). Consider refactoring.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,175 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"encoding/json"
+	"fmt"
+	"io/ioutil"
+	"path/filepath"
+
+	vegeta "github.com/tsenart/vegeta/lib"
+)
+
+type orgTargetConfig struct {
+	Method      string
+	BaseURL     string
+	Path        string
+	AccessToken string
+	FilePattern string // Optional file pattern location(s)
+	ID          string // Optional id to append to url
+}
+
+type orgTargeter struct {
+	bodies chan []byte // channel for generating new request bodies
+	orgTargetConfig
+}
+
+// NewOrgTargeter constructs a new orgTargeter using provided config
+func NewOrgTargeter(config orgTargetConfig) *orgTargeter {
+	targeter := &orgTargeter{
+		bodies:          make(chan []byte),
+		orgTargetConfig: config,
+	}
+
+	targeter.genReqs()
+
+	return targeter
+}
+
+// genReqs setups the go routine necessary to generate new request bodies
+// used by the vegeta test runner
+func (o *orgTargeter) genReqs() {

commit.message: refactor tests files and setup file into new file structure
move org and accesstoken generation to test files
remove clienttoken return from setuporgauth function
Move org id creation to setupauthorg method
Increase vegeta targeter timeout to decrease timeout likelihood
update import for practitioner to be the same as the other files

nodes.bodyText: Similar blocks of code found in 2 locations. Consider refactoring.
Similar blocks of code found in 2 locations. Consider refactoring.
Method API.RunTokenTests has 51 lines of code (exceeds 50 allowed). Consider refactoring.
I think there's a risk of confusion here because the golden macaroon comes from an admin endpoint rather than an API endpoint. Maybe better in dpc or an admin package?

@@ -0,0 +1,125 @@
+// Package dpc contains all test methods, the api test runner, and common functionalities
+package dpc
+
+import (
+	"crypto/rsa"
+	"encoding/json"
+	"fmt"
+	"io/ioutil"
+	"os"
+	"path/filepath"
+
+	"github.com/CMSgov/dpc-app/dpc-testing/performance/pkg/dpc/targeter"
+)
+
+type Resource struct {
+	ID          string `json:"id"`
+	ClientToken []byte `json:"token"`
+	AccessToken string `json:"access_token"`
+}
+
+// Pull `ids` out of a set of response bodies
+func unmarshalIDs(resps [][]byte) []string {
+	var IDs []string
+	for _, resp := range resps {
+		var result Resource
+		json.Unmarshal(resp, &result)
+		IDs = append(IDs, result.ID)
+	}
+
+	return IDs
+}
+
+// Pull `clientTokens` out of a set of response bodies
+func unmarshalClientTokens(resps [][]byte) [][]byte {
+	var clientTokens [][]byte
+	for _, resp := range resps {
+		var result Resource
+		json.Unmarshal(resp, &result)
+		clientTokens = append(clientTokens, result.ClientToken)
+	}
+
+	return clientTokens
+}
+
+// Pull `accessTokens` out of a set of response bodies
+func unmarshalAccessTokens(resps [][]byte) []string {
+	var accessTokens []string
+	for _, resp := range resps {
+		var result Resource
+		json.Unmarshal(resp, &result)
+		accessTokens = append(accessTokens, result.AccessToken)
+	}
+
+	return accessTokens
+}
+
+var FHIR = "application/fhir+json"
+var JSON = "application/json"
+var PLAIN = "text/plain"
+var FORM = "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
+var UNSET = ""

nodes.bodyText: Could Headers() be changed to take a variable number of parameters so an unset one isn't required?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+package dpc
+
+import (
+	"github.com/CMSgov/dpc-app/dpc-testing/performance/pkg/dpc/targeter"
+)
+
+func (api *API) RunKeyTests() {
+	const ENDPOINT = "Key"
+
+	// Create organization (and delete at the end) and setup accesstoken
+	auth := api.SetupOrgAuth()
+	defer api.DeleteOrg(auth.orgID)
+
+	// POST /Key
+	resps := targeter.New(targeter.Config{
+		Method:      "POST",
+		BaseURL:     api.URL,
+		Endpoint:    ENDPOINT,
+		AccessToken: auth.accessToken,
+		Bodies:      generateKeyBodies(25, api.GenerateKeyPairAndSignature),
+		Headers:     Headers(JSON, UNSET),

commit.message: Move token generation to a separate struct for admin calls and embedd in api struct

nodes.bodyText: Will it matter now or in the future that we're reusing the same NPI for multiple orgs?  This is the same as the base org, and all the others use 2906714268.
